item.title: Student support
item.description: ILAS welcomes and encourages students to attend the ILAS conference. For this purpose, the society offers two types of support for PhD students. Registration fee-waiver Travel / accommodation support up to 700 USD The students who would like to apply for one or both of them should fill in the application form before January 31. Registration fee-waiver Students can join ILAS for free and benefit from the reduced registration fee.

item.title: Social events
item.description: Welcome reception The reception will be held at the conference venue on Monday evening. Taiwanese delicacies and beverage will be served to welcome the linear algbera community. Price: included in the registration fee Excursion The excursion will be held on Wednesday afternoon. There are two options. Option 1: Cruise tour in Kaoshiung Harbor (limited vacancies) As the largest harbor in Taiwan, Kaohsiung Harbor serves as both an economic and cultural hub.

item.title: Local
item.description: Kaohsiung Kaohsiung is a big city in southern Taiwan. It is located on the southwest coast and is one of Taiwan’s largest cities. Kaohsiung has a population of around 2.7 million people. The city has a rich history with a former name Takow given by the indigenous people. It was originally a small fishing village many years ago. Over time, it grew into an important port city. Today, Kaohsiung is known for its busy harbor, which is one of the largest in the world.

item.title: Plan your trip
item.description: Visa Many countries are eligible for the visa exemption program, with a duration of stay of up to 90 days. In general, you may follow the instructions of the Bureau of Consular Affairs to apply for a visa. Airport With fewer flight options, Kaohsiung International Airport (KHH) is the closest airport to the conference venue. Taiwan Taoyuan International Airport (TPE) is the primary airport of Taiwan and is an important hub in Asia.

item.title: Welcoming and Inclusiveness Statement
item.description: The ILAS2025 organizing team will adhere to the Welcoming and Inclusiveness Statement of ILAS and make the conference an friendly environment for all. Welcoming and Inclusiveness Statement The International Linear Algebra Society (ILAS) is comprised of a diverse global membership. It is the policy of ILAS to offer a welcoming and inclusive environment to all participants in its activities, including all its meetings and conferences, regardless of gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion or religious belief, age, marital status, disabilities, and field of expertise.
